alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains Foothills; Eastern Culberson County; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CULBERSON COUNTY THROUGH 630 PM CDT... At 600 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles north of Plateau, or 22 miles northwest of Kent, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Culberson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains Foothills; Eastern Culberson County; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
